attributes.action: Make the 5th of July NHS day, and a national holiday.
attributes.background: I feel that many now, so far on from it's inception truly understand a lot about when and how it started. As a whole, we just take it for granted, and have become blase about it. Yet it's treated all of us, saved lives, including my own, and more than once. It deserves to be celebrated by us all.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of cruel halal meat in the UK
attributes.background: Stop the cruel slaughter of innocent animals for halal meat. Stop the sale of halal meat in UK.

attributes.action: Auto British Citizenship for EU Citizens working here for more than 10 years.
attributes.background: Give automatic British Citizenship to EU Nationals living and working in the UK for more than 10 years that never committed a crime and never claimed benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
The current process to obtain British Citizenship is outdated, too expensive and does not reward law abiding EU citizens that have been working in the UK for a long time and contributing to the wealth and cultural richness of the UK. 

EU Citizens should not need to pay for ESOL Tests if they been living here for so long and have other UK qualifications at Level 2 or above. 

Work and tax records should be checked by simply asking the applicant to provide their National Insurance Number.

attributes.action: Regulate political campaign material and communications
attributes.background:
In the most recent UK referendum on membership of the EU, campaign materials & messages on both sides contained gross mistruths, irregularities and exaggeration.

Citizens must be able to rely on campaign messages which are clear, factual and informative so that we can submit fully informed votes
attributes.additional_details: The Electoral Commission regulates a lot of the process around elections & voting, but there is currently no regulation from any body on political campaign materials and messages. I propose that the EC's remit is extended to regulate this as well. This would enable the voting public to execute their democratic right in a fully informed way. As to ask people to make an important choice on anything other than independently-verified facts & information runs the risk of destabilising our democracy.

attributes.action: Amend Shortage Occupation rules that are blocking the hiring of Specialist Chefs
attributes.background: UK's Asian cuisine industry is lacking skill ready Professional Chefs. Though Chefs are on government's Shortage Occupation list it disqualifies restaurants that allow collection or delivery of restaurant meals as NOT having specialist skill needs in spite of this involving the same skill input
attributes.additional_details:
The industry is in urgent need of experienced skill ready Chefs from outside EU on temporary basis to support business operations, and to enable training and development of home grown Chefs. However this is being prevented by inappropriate rules. This petition calls for following amendments to the Shortage Occupation rules 

1. Remove the 'take away' clause

2. Raise skill recognition to NQF level 6  

3. Amend minimum salary to £25,000 

4. Allow temporary non settlement based UK entry

attributes.action: Rectify a disparity in MOD regulations over the use of Unit badges on memorials.
attributes.background: The three Services have their own rules for which names, Crests or Unit Badges can be used on private, family instigated memorials and/or their headstone, post mortem. The Royal Navy and Army state that any amount of service is acceptable, where as the RAF can require as much as 20 years service

attributes.action: Introduce a legal ratio of nurse to patient.
attributes.background: Something I have witnessed not only as a Healthcare Assistant but also as a student nurse is the increasing number of patients a Staff Nurse is being forced to care for. The government need to recognise this is wrong and jeopardising patient safety! Make the legal limit 1 Nurse: 8 Patients.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm a student nurse who is looking to work for the NHS once I qualify, however, this growing number of patients that Nurses are being made to look after TERRIFIES me! 
There needs to be a limit put in place to safeguard Nurses and patients. It isn't safe to have up to 12 patients to 1 Nurse. 
Avoidable mistakes are being made daily on wards due to low levels of staffing! 
Imagine it was your mother, father, nan or grandad who was admitted to hospital where the Nurse can't give them the best care

attributes.action: Change  'Assaulting a Police Officer' to Assaulting Emergency Services personnel
attributes.background: Members of the emergency services are being assaulted across the country leaving them with severe injurys that stop them from doing the amazing work they do. This should not be tolerated and should be felt with as severely as Assaulting a Police Office has for many years.
attributes.additional_details: Across the news the past month, story's are arising of emergency services Personel being assaulted while carrying out the jobs. Ambulance staff that are there to treat and help people are being assaulted leaving them with serious injurys that stop them from working. The law should be changed to help combat the disgusting behaviour that is being seen across the country.

attributes.action: We call on the Government to offer anonymity to victims of revenge porn
attributes.background:
Last year the Coalition made it illegal to disclose private sexual photographs and videos with intent to cause distress. 

Offering anonymity to victims empowers them to come forward to get justice. They shouldn't have to suffer in silence to protect any privacy they have left.

attributes.action: Scrap Tax on Savings Income altogether, NOT just the 1st £1000
attributes.background: As Interest rates on 'Savings Accounts' are at record lows currently, people are now struggling to live off their savings incomes, which the government taxes after the 1st £1000 income at 20%.
attributes.additional_details: The government can easily scrap this tax for savers, forever, in the next Budget, also, would save a lot of people having to complete the Self-Assessment to repay Savings Income above £1000.

attributes.action: Legally require force food suppliers to label all halal blessed/slaughtered meat
attributes.background:
I am not Muslim, i do not wish to eat halal meat, l do not agree with it religiously & ethically, i support animal rights.
I have accidentally eaten halal meat and this caused me religious and ethical issues and has deeply offended me, i demand ALL shops clearly label halal blessed/slaughtered meat
attributes.additional_details:
Tesco- "we do not specify to suppliers whether halal practices should be followed"
M&S-  "we do not specify any religious practice as part of our sourcing policy so therefore do not label"

Sainsburys- "in NZ it is common for lamb to be blessed"

Morrisons- "all our lamb from NZ is pre-stunned and blessed"

Co-Op- "there is currently no UK wide labelling scheme"

ASDA- "No comment"

Waitrose- " there is currently no UK labelly scheme and we believe this is a matter where government should lead "

attributes.action: Raise minimum wage of 18-20 year olds to that of 21 year olds
attributes.background: The current minimum wage for 18-20 year olds in the UK is £5.30. The current minimum wage for 21- 24 year olds is £6.70. This is a huge gap even though the cost of living is exactly the same; the cost of food, rent and bills is not lower - so why is the rate of pay?
attributes.additional_details: For every 40 hours a 21 year old works, an 18 year old has to work an additional 10 hours to earn the same amount of money - this is essentially an extra week's worth of work every month.18-20 year olds are constantly exploited in the workplace because of this. Working for 200 hours pays around £1,060 before tax and national insurance, working for the recommended 160 hours pays around £870. For a whole month this is not enough for an independent person to live off.

attributes.action: Increase the penalty for those involved in the puppy farm trade.
attributes.background: Puppy farming is one of the largest contributors of animal cruelty within Britain. No animal should have to go through the distress and abusive conditions that happen within this barbaric industry. Those who take part in this trade should suffer a heavy penalty for this act of cruelty.

attributes.action: Keep breast screening at 47 or younger to help save lives!
attributes.background: My sister was diagnosed with stage 3 breast cancer at 48. If she hadnt been screened this early she might not have been here today. I had  breast screening at 47 and was diagnosed with primary breast cancer, if I hadn't been seen until 50, it would have been much worse. Screening early is essential.
attributes.additional_details: Early detection of breast cancer can mean less money being spent by the NHS. Less chemotherapy needed. Less drugs needed. Consultants would rather catch cancers early so why are the NHS taking the age back up 50? My sister and I will be doing more research into this. But we want to get the petition up.and running a soon as possible.  Cancer destroys whole families. Dont let the NHS trust go backwards in cancer detection!

attributes.action: FAIR TRADING-include the details of the leather source on the products labels.
attributes.background: Our campaign, aims to expose and end the cruelty within the leather industry. Consumer Rights Reg.from Unfair Trading 2008 /1277, Reg. 6 (consumer right to be protected from unfair trading, where it is likely to cause the consumer to take a transactional decision he would not have taken otherwise).
attributes.additional_details: large portion of the leather available on the world market is exported, under omitted information such as “leather from an animal farmed for meat“. Some cultures, particularly Asian considers dogs and cats as “animals farmed for meat”. Our campaign aims to expose and end the cruelty within the leather industry. Based on existing legislation we therefore require that all retailers and traders include the details of the leather source on the products labels. We demand to know what it is we are buying

attributes.action: Change the NHS dental provision so everyone has access. We've already paid.
attributes.background:
Nhs dentistry should be available for all.
People are anable to access routine and emergency NHS dental care when needed.
Children have toothache, a preventable disease.
Toothache is agonising - easily fixed. People extract using pliers 
Funding is being diverted from dental commissioning
attributes.additional_details:
Work started in Dewsbury tackling access to dental provision in Dec. 15. The audit is published here:

http://therealjunktoothproject.org/news/

We engaged with local people in need of help. 

We have worked with The Real Junk Food Project Dewsbury CIC to engage with people who we are 'recruiting to eat food'. If they can't afford to eat, they can't afford private healthcare to sort out teeth. 

We need a people focused response and positive action.

attributes.action: Drivers caught using a mobile phone whilst driving 6 penalty points. £1000 fine.
attributes.background: I have been an undertaker for many years. I have witnessed the aftermath and carnage whilst attending fatal crashes, where driver has been distracted by using mobile phone and lost control. The percentage of motorists using phones has risen!!! in the past 5 years. They are laughing at the law.
attributes.additional_details: I still remember attending a fatality where the driver had driven into back of lorry...his mobile phone still connected to the call.

attributes.action: Refund visa applicants who have paid the IHS and then contributed towards NI
attributes.background: I am a British citizen living and working in the UK with my South African-born husband and 2 children who are here on spousal/dependant visas. Both my husband and I have been working here for the past 2 and a half years and paying National Insurance.
attributes.additional_details: Last year, an Immigration Health Surcharge was introduced for all non EEA persons applying for visas to come to the UK for more than 6 months in order to cover the NHS. My family are about to apply for Further Leave to Remain and we now have to fork out £1500 for the IHS. I understand the need to charge for the use of the NHS, but what I fail to understand is why we can’t claim this back as a tax refund at the end of the year when we are paying £7872 pa into National Insurance.

attributes.action: More support for people underweight (programs/support groups)
attributes.background: I lost a lot of weight and dropped to 5st 4... I see weight watchers and slimming world all over but theirs nothing for people underweight! I am a one woman army trying to get heard. I was in the daily mail with my story now I want to help others!
attributes.additional_details: Theirs 13,000 weight watchers meetings happening every week yet for underweight people there's a hotline to call which is only open for 9 hours!

attributes.action: REMOVE THE TRIDENT MISSILE SYSTEM AND ALL THE NUCLEAR SUBMARINES FROM SCOTLAND.
attributes.background: Trident is a WMD and the people of Scotland do not want it housed in their back gardens. We seek the urgent removal of this obscene weapon from Scottish waters.

attributes.action: Investigate the appalling service provided by Southern Rail during 2016
attributes.background: This year many trains have been cancelled by this company outside of industrial action. The company have cited staff shortages. But this is happening every day of every week. Surely their planning &/or HR department should & could have seen this coming.
attributes.additional_details: Only today two trains have been cancelled on the southern network. The 08:09 Southampton central & 08:30 Chichester. Many people rely on these services including school children who may be left venerable waiting on platforms when their parents are expecting them at a different time. This is a shocking service and needs to be resolved.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory all authorities scan all domestic pets!
attributes.background: Bodies working in the animal sector, such as vets & shelters, usually scan for a microchip. However this is not compulsory and there are other authorities who will not scan at all such as a number of councils. All authorities working with animals, by law, should be required to scan all domestic pets
attributes.additional_details:
Microchips in domestic pets were introduced so, should an animal be lost or found injured, an owner could be located and notified. 
There is no current legislation which states any authority who comes in to contact with animals has any legal obligation to scan them. 
Dogs and cats can be collected & disposed of by councils without having been scanned and owners will never be informed. This leads to great distress and upset when the owner has a right to be informed of the fate of their companion

attributes.action: Make a National Doctors' Day
attributes.background: Doctors provide care with altruistic values. Some countries like USA, India and Iran recognise their doctors with a special day. Such a day would recognise doctors' contribution to society.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 1933, USA has been celebrating a national doctors' day on 9th May, signed in law by President George Bush in 1990. Iran recognises famous physician, Avicenna and celebrates his birthday as doctors' day. In UK, Such a celebration will help doctors build their self-esteem and create a binding relationship between doctors and their patients. 
It should not a national holiday but a day of celebration and acknowledgement in hospitals and GP surgeries, just like nurses day (12th May).

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for Group Strep B to be tested in every pregnancy
attributes.background: Group Strep B can be fatal to newborns and can be picked up during pregnancy. All it takes is a simple blood test (which are done in early stages anyway) or a swab. This needs to be made mandatory so it can be dealt with in the correct way during labour and afterbirth etc. Please help make it happen

attributes.action: Establish a day for the NHS as a public holiday to celebrate Britain at its best
attributes.background: We currently lack a national holiday. Recent events show how uniquely the NHS unites people across political divides. The 70th anniversary of the NHS is in 2018. We can celebrate annually something which shows us at our best. The whole nation made and protects the NHS, and it cares for all of us.
attributes.additional_details:
Our NHS was declared the best healthcare system in a respected international survey of different services. It came top for quality, access and efficiency, in spite of spending the second lowest amount per person.

(See: The Commonwealth Fund (2014) Mirror, Mirror on the Wall, 2014 Update: How the U.S. Health Care System Compares Internationally, Washington D.C.)

attributes.action: Let learner riders over 25 ride a 250cc on L plates
attributes.background: Older riders have more sense and control than younger riders and with bike specs getting safer bigger bikes for older riders will bring down the amount of accidents we feel the law should change on the cc learners can ride
attributes.additional_details: It's proven that the bigger cc bikes have more chance of getting out of situations than smaller ones do most incidents involve 17 to 21 year olds through lack of control whereas 25 plus riders have more concentration and the ability to see oncoming danger and react more quickly

attributes.action: Remove Vat from sun creams of factor 30+ to reduce the incidence  skin cancers.
attributes.background: Expensive Sun tan creams discourage the use of this protection. The incidence of sun related skin cancers is rising as the strength of ultraviolet radiation increases. Act now to protect your and your children's skin from premature aging and the risk of developing potentially fatal skin cancers.
attributes.additional_details: Skin cancer.org

attributes.action: Fireworks - ONLY SOLD to the public with licence from Local Council @ £50.
attributes.background:
Sale of FIREWORKS - The way forward
a)  To purchase FIREWORKS public need to obtain a licence from their Local Council.  Licence should be at least £50, dates avail on a website.
b)  People need to use Facebook/media as a Communication tool to let others know about forthcoming firework displays.

attributes.action: A curriculum for the future. Give the youth a voice with in the education system
attributes.background:
We want a compulsory PHSE, that includes the following subjects :
•	Political, economics and current affairs. 
•	Wellbeing- basic life skills, mental health
•	Community cohesion & Cultural awareness-Justice, equality, discrimination
•	Finance, employment and enterprise
•	Social responsibility
attributes.additional_details:
Consultation with in schools and youth clubs in Manchester.
UKYP, National make your mark consultation- Curriculum for life coming in top 5 for 3 consecutive times.

attributes.action: Set up an independent commission to draft a new Representation of the People Act
attributes.background: Increasingly we are being asked to choose between extreme positions defined by the grassroots of both parties. Eg, holding a referendum without any predefined implementation plans means that, at this critical time in our history, the UK's future will be decided by 150,000 Conservative Party members.
attributes.additional_details: The old party models no longer correspond to the reality of 21st century society. We need a full reform of the electoral and parliamentary systems, possibly with some form of proportional or alternative voting system, and with a second house that could be selected across the whole of society by something akin to jury service. To decide what reforms are needed, an independent commission should be set up to propose a major overhaul of the system by means of a new Reform Act.

attributes.action: Outlaw the choosing of Prime Ministers by party members who are not MPs
attributes.background: The choice of a new Prime Minister between general elections should not be delegated by elected MPs to unelected and unaccountable party members as if the office was a private possession of the party in power and those who have paid it a membership fee.

attributes.action: Abloish Road Tax Ved Tax for road Vehicles. Add2/2.5% to tax on petrol.
attributes.background: Currently there is a lot of debate about Vehicle excise duty. Whether there should be a 25 30 or 40 year rolling excemption. If the government added 2/2.5% on to the amount they take in tax form the cost of fuel, this would make the Treasury more money even short term. Fairer for all.
attributes.additional_details: The system I am proposing would be fairer to everyone in the whole country no mater what vehicle they own or drive. This would safe money as the DVLA wold not need to chase up or remind people to renew their Road Tax. The Government is always telling us we are all in this together and moving on. Well if we are all in this together and if we are moving on, this would simplify collecting Road Tax. The additional revenue could be ring fenced and put back into our road system and repair upgrade it.

attributes.action: Introduce meat and dairy taxes to correct market failure in the food industry
attributes.background: Food production causes a quarter of all greenhouse gas emissions that are driving global warming. Both the UN International Research Panel and the Oxford University Martin Programme have suggested pricing in the environmental impacts of meat and dairy are vital steps to combating climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
The Oxford report states average surcharges of 40% on beef and 20% on milk would account for the damage they cause people via climate change and Maarten Hajer, the lead author of the UN report has recommended similar action. We hereby call on the government to implement such taxes to help meet our international obligations to combat climate change. 

http://www.nature.com/nclimate/journal/vaop/ncurrent/pdf/nclimate3155.pdf
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/bhhivquadq7ycnd/AAAIl8mVW9GCiOyGwk71At_ra?dl=0

attributes.action: Reopen the railway line between Calne and Chippenham
attributes.background: The branch line between Calne and Chippenham was closed in 1965, and with Calne constantly growing, and more and more people working in Chippenham (or elsewhere requiring further travel from Chippenham Station), a single carriage train running backwards and forwards seems a good idea.
attributes.additional_details: For more information on the old Railway line visit: http://www.railuk.info/lines/getline.php?id=1

attributes.action: We are calling on the Govt to strip Thameslink Govia of their rail franchise.
attributes.background: Govia Thameslink has the highest number of passenger journeys but the lowest customer satisfaction rates and the lowest PPM of any UK rail network. There has been a continuous decline in their PPM measure since 2015. They have the second highest rate of cancellation & significantly late running.
attributes.additional_details:
Thameslink Govia's poor management is evident in:
The lack of adequate contingency plans to cope with disruption.
Poor & inaccurate information provided to customers 
The ongoing staffing disputes without major disruption to the network. 
Continually increasing fares with declining service levels

We urge the government to urgently review the situation and award the franchise to a company which can deliver a consistent, good level of service.

attributes.action: People who save for a pension shouldn't be taxed on it when they retire.
attributes.background: People who save for a pension do so and reduce their monthly spend. A pension is to help in later life when you need every penny. I had less of a life style to ensure I could look after my family in my later years. No taxing pensions when you retire would also encourage more to save.

attributes.action: Ensure that the triple lock on the Basic State Pension is retained
attributes.background:
The government is considering ending this
The triple lock is a guarantee to increase the state pension every year by the higher of inflation, average earnings or a minimum of 2.5%.
This is essential to ensure the poorest of retired people can manage in winter

attributes.action: Abolish the 1 hour clock changes in March and October and introduce double BST
attributes.background:
The clocks going back in October is shown to increase road accidents, crime, and mental health conditions such as SAD due to the darker nights. 
Double BST would put us at GMT+1 in winter, and GMT+2 in summer, bringing us into line with Europe.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the RoSPA, more people are killed and injured in road accidents due to the darker Autumn and winter evenings. 
Cambridge university estimates 450,000 tonnes of carbon emissions saved per year. 
It would align the UK with European times, aiding businesses. 
It would boost tourism that is dependent on daylight hours by up to two months a year. 
It would shift the average year long sunset time from 18:35 to 19:30, giving an average of 55minutes per day of extra light in the evenings.

attributes.action: When failing qts tests, Remove the 2 Year ban after failing tests 3 times
attributes.background: When future trainee teachers fail there qts tests 3 times, there is a two year ban for re-sitting the tests. However when a person fails there theory test 3 times, they do not get a two year ban. I suggest the ban be removed. The tests should be re-sat unlimited times, until passed.
attributes.additional_details: The tests will still need to be passed therefore the same high standard is set.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for a mother to deny contact with a child's father
attributes.background: Many mothers denying fathers having contact with there child for no reason what so ever! If the father is willing to step up and support there child, be there for them and care for them then why stop access?

attributes.action: Give work permits to illegal immigrants living in the UK for over 3 years.
attributes.background:
UK Government should give work permits to illegal immigrants who have been in the UK for over 3 years.
These illegal immigrants are from war torn or poverty stricken nations. To send them back to their countries is sending them to their deaths.
attributes.additional_details:
United Kingdom is a nation of compassionate, loving, hardworking, generous, hospitable and peaceful people.
Giving work permits to illegal immigrants who have been in the UK for over 3 years and have no criminal record will lead to:
1. Increase in UK's work force
2. Increase in UK's sources of income.
3. Added values to British rich cultures
4. Increase in UK's leading role as the most compassionate and generous nation on earth.

attributes.action: Create an online voting system using NI numbers as identication to vote
attributes.background: I believe that a better voting system would involve using the Internet as a platform as more people would come forward to vote as it has easier access and by using the NI numbers everyone with have a unique number in which to cast their vote.

attributes.action: Change all road signs to display metric measurements in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: In the UK, we have an outstanding problem. The continued mix-up of both metric and imperial measurements in our society confuses the great British people, especially to the younger generation. Completing the change to an easy and logical measuring system would be both inexpensive and simple.
attributes.additional_details: We buy our fuel for vehicles in litres, however the efficiency of cars is measured in "miles per gallon". Car manufacturers design the dimensions of cars in metric measurements however our roads signs display imperial. Old-fashioned measurements bring confusion to people from other societies and can lead to road accidents due to different measurement restrictions. Changing our road signage to display distance in metres and kilometres, vehicle restrictions in metres and speed given in kilometres per hour will help to end the in-consistency of measurements in the UK.

attributes.action: To consider protecting CC41&11011 the historic symbols under IPO article 6_ter
attributes.background: I would like you to consider protecting the historic expired marks CC41 and 11011 under article 6_ter or equivalent Non EU regulation so that it remains free to use by the people and not that of sole property of an individual so that they are able to gain financial reward.
attributes.additional_details: It recently came to my attention that an individual has successfully published the iconic CC41, I intend to fully challange the Mark personally and have appealed and invited the millions of Brits to join me in this campaign,  so that the trademark CC41 is not granted solely to the individual Mr Douglas Steward, further information of this can be found on the IPO website under the words "CC41" The double 11s symbol 11011, another iconic symbol I also wish you to consider protecting.

attributes.action: Change Just in Case medication policy to Debbiebox a NHS Standard practice in GP
attributes.background: My mum spent 4 hour dying in pain due to MAR chart missing. Ambulance Crew couldn't give drugs needed. My mum died hospital 1hr pain free. I had to watch her. Just in Case box is NOT standard practice. We want a Debbiebox in place in every GP with MAR, DNS and drugs and comes direct from GP.
attributes.additional_details:
The MAR charts was not requested at my GP and was missed out.  District nurse request a JUST IN CASE BOX. This GP didn't have a box policy.

The Debbiebox is a palliative care box which will have telephone numbers, drugs, MAR chart and DNR form, syringes it will be done by a GP alone.

Currently each GP has their own policy it should be standard practice so no miscommunication happens resulting in mistakes and someone dying in pain. 
This would stop compensation claims and is cost effective.

attributes.action: Let private hire vehicles use bus lanes just like black cabs can
attributes.background: We as private hire drivers do the same job as bus drivers and black cab drivers so why ain't we allowed to use bus lanes

attributes.action: Allocate UK share of the EU science budget to UKRI for transnational research
attributes.background: Research & Innovation helps drive our economy.  Collaboration with international partners is essential to maintain the world-leading standard of UK research.  The UK has been one of the top beneficiaries from EU research and innovation framework funding programmes, enabling this activity.
attributes.additional_details:
Leaving the EU will jeopardise this support to quality and quantity of UK research.  The UK share of this fund should be protected for use for this purpose going forward.  Mechanisms most appropriate to the political situation will take time to clarify, yet the commitment to support this area of economic growth-driving should be made now.

http://tinyurl.com/jeyqy2k 
http://tinyurl.com/gwvo5u9 
http://tinyurl.com/zpop9n9

attributes.action: Urge FIFA to overturn the England V Scotland Poppy Ban
attributes.background: FIFA want to stop players wearing Poppies at the game, as apparently it is a political statement?  How is honouring our Armed Forces doing this?  I feel the Government should urge FIFA to overturn this ban.

attributes.action: Review and change criteria that allow people to donate blood
attributes.background: Currently huge groups of people, such as men who have sex with men, are unable to donate blood, due to creteria based on out of date views and stereotypes. These need to be reviewed and the discrimination needs to stop! There are always adverts crying out for donors but they stop those willing!
attributes.additional_details: A gay man in a long term monogamous relationship can be denied as a donor, where a heterosexual man sleeping with multiple partners is allowed. This outdated view on men who have sex with men is fuelling the discrimination faced by them on a daily basis. This needs to be reviewed and changed and then perhaps there wouldn't be as many shortages. MSMs can be on the organ donor register and can sign up to the Anthony Nolan Trust so why shouldn't they be able to donate blood

attributes.action: Stop agencies fining those who cannot attend work because of an emergency
attributes.background: Agencies are currently able to issue fines to workers if they do not give 48 hours prior notice that they are unable to attend a shift. If they have an emergency or illness in that 48 hour window they will be fined, whether or not they provide a reason.
attributes.additional_details:
One agency that does this is ROTA, which provides hospitality staff. Given that it is illegal to handle food within 48 hours of diarrhoea or vommiting you could effectively be fined for abiding by the law. 

It is outrageous to fine some of the lowest paid in our society. They already give up a lot of rights by having to take zero hour contracts, and to fine those in the most precarious of employment is deplorable.
